intro: Ormocarpum megalophyllum, commonly known as the giant leaf orchid, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its large, showy leaves that can reach up to two feet in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swamps. Botanically, it belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley.
